item.title: 一连串坏消息后德国投资者信心大跌
item.description: 有进一步迹象表明，德国关键的制造业萎靡不振，投资者对德国经济的信心跌至近一年来的最低水平。【原文：Investor confidence in Germany’s economy plunged to its lowest level in almost a year after further signs of a deepening malaise in the key manufacturing sector.】

item.title: 市场取决于鲍威尔效仿格林斯潘的软着陆策略
item.description: 1995 年，格林斯潘率领美联储实现了罕见的软着陆，交易员们将此作为四年来首次降息的交易指南。【原文：Traders are harking back on 1995, when Alan Greenspan led the Federal Reserve in pulling off a rare soft landing, for a playbook on trading the first interest-rate cut in four years.】

item.title: Exane 称爱马仕是应对奢侈品增长放缓的防御性交易
item.description: 法国巴黎银行（BNP Paribas）Exane 分析师认为，爱马仕国际是投资者规避奢侈品行业短期低迷的一个途径，他们首次将这家 Birkin 手袋制造商的评级提升至 "跑赢大盘"。【原文：Hermes International is a way for investors to shield themselves from a short-term downturn in the luxury-goods sector, according to BNP Paribas Exane analysts, who upgraded the Birkin bag maker to outperform for the first time.】

item.title: 美国银行民调显示，美联储押注自 6 月以来首次提升了市场情绪
item.description: 据美国银行（Bank of America Corp）的一项全球调查显示，美联储备受期待的降息政策所带来的乐观情绪自 6 月份以来首次提振了投资者的情绪。【原文：Optimism around the Federal Reserve’s highly anticipated interest-rate cuts has boosted investor sentiment for the first time since June, according to a global survey by Bank of America Corp.】

item.title: 交通游说团预测：更便宜的电动汽车将刺激欧洲需求
item.description: 据运输与amp; 环境游说团体称，随着汽车制造商开始推出更便宜的车型以扭转电动汽车需求低迷的局面，明年电动汽车在欧洲的市场份额可能高达 24%。【原文：Electric cars could reach a market share of as much as 24% in Europe next year as carmakers start to release cheaper models to turn around the slump in EV demand, according to the Transport & Environment lobby group.】

item.title: 波兰图斯克称欧盟将为洪灾救灾预留 15 亿欧元
item.description: 波兰总理唐纳德-图斯克（Donald Tusk）表示，欧盟准备投入 15 亿欧元（17 亿美元）帮助各国进行洪灾后重建。【原文：Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk said that the European Union is poised to commit €1.5 billion ($1.7 billion) to help countries rebuild after the flood.】

item.title: 香港多年来最大规模上市吸引全球投资者回归
item.description: 中国家电制造商美的集团股份有限公司（Midea Group Co.【原文：Chinese appliance maker Midea Group Co.’s $4 billion listing in Hong Kong is fueling cautious optimism that the worst of the city’s capital markets drought may be coming to an end.】

item.title: 亿万富翁科塔克（Kotak）旗下公司将推出首只私人信贷基金
item.description: 印度亿万富翁乌代-科塔克（Uday Kotak）集团旗下的一个分支机构正计划在今年推出其首支私人信贷基金，与业内同行一起急于开拓蓬勃发展的直接借贷市场。【原文：An arm of Indian billionaire Uday Kotak’s group is planning to launch its first private credit fund this year, joining industry peers rushing to tap the booming market for direct lending.】

item.title: 英特尔停止计划中的芯片工厂，德国面临新的挫折
item.description: 英特尔公司（Intel Corp. ）决定推迟其在德国建厂的计划，这标志着柏林政府遭遇挫折，并将再次引发关于如何分配约 100 亿欧元（110 亿美元）专项补贴的争议。【原文：Intel Corp.’s decision to postpone its planned factory in Germany marks a setback for the government in Berlin and will reignite controversy over where to allocate about €10 billion ($11 billion) in earmarked subsidies.】

item.title: 欧洲央行西姆库斯称 10 月降息的可能性 "非常小
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员吉迪米纳斯-西姆库斯（Gediminas Simkus）表示，欧洲中央银行下个月再次降息的可能性很小。【原文：There’s little chance that the European Central Bank will lower interest rates again next month, according to Governing Council member Gediminas Simkus.】

item.title: 人工智能初创公司 Sakana 价值达 15 亿美元，日本公司纷纷注资注资
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的人士说，在日本一些最大的银行和公司的投资推动下，英伟达公司支持的 Sakana AI 在推出一年多一点的时间里估值就达到了 15 亿美元。【原文：Nvidia Corp.-backed Sakana AI was valued at $1.5 billion a little over a year after its launch, boosted by investments from some of Japan’s biggest banks and companies, a person familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: Playtech 管理人员将从 Flutter 交易中获得 1 亿欧元的意外之财
item.description: Playtech Plc 计划将其出售给 Flutter Entertainment Plc 的意大利博彩业务 Snaitech 退还给股东高达 18 亿欧元（20 亿美元），这也将为其高层管理人员带来一笔丰厚的意外之财。【原文：Playtech Plc’s plan to return up to €1.8 billion ($2 billion) to shareholders from the sale of its Italian gambling business Snaitech to Flutter Entertainment Plc will also result in a handy windfall for its top managers.】

item.title: 大众汽车就业危机对欧洲经济的影响
item.description: 大众汽车公司（Volkswagen AG）将关闭德国本土的工厂，这在其历史上尚属首次。彭博经济研究公司（Bloomberg Economics）的研究显示，如果出现这种情况，通胀可能会出现结构性上升，经常账户盈余可能会缩小，投资流向可能会发生变化。【原文：Volkswagen AG is set to shutter factories in its German homeland for the first time in its history, a move that pulls at a thread that could see a decades-long deal between workers and their employers unravel. If it does, inflation could move structurally higher, current account surpluses could shrink and investment flows could shift, according to Bloomberg Economics research.】

item.title: 华平投资的普林斯顿数字公司考虑融资 10 亿美元
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，华平投资（Warburg Pincus）支持的数据中心运营商普林斯顿数字集团（Princeton Digital Group）正在考虑进行一轮私募融资，融资额高达 10 亿美元。【原文：Princeton Digital Group, a Warburg Pincus-backed data center operator, is considering a private fundraising round to raise as much as $1 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美联储准备减息，新兴市场债务将迎来意外之财
item.description: 摩根大通资产管理公司（JPMorgan Asset Management）、Van Eck Associates Corp.公司和Vontobel Asset Management公司押注，随着美国借贷成本下降，从新兴市场撤出的数十亿美元将开始回流。【原文：JPMorgan Asset Management, Van Eck Associates Corp. and Vontobel Asset Management are betting that the billions of dollars pulled from emerging markets will start coming back as US borrowing costs drop.】

item.title: 联想将在印度生产人工智能服务器，推动印度科技进步
item.description: 联想集团有限公司（Lenovo Group Ltd.）开始在印度南部建造人工智能服务器，这是印度迅速发展成为高科技强国的最新利好。【原文：Lenovo Group Ltd. started building AI servers in India’s south, the latest boon for the rapidly growing country’s push to become a high-tech powerhouse.】

item.title: THG 计划分拆技术部门，以推动其纳入富时指数
item.description: THG Plc 计划剥离其技术平台，并将其核心美容和营养业务转为上市，以提振这家电子商务公司疲软的股价。【原文：THG Plc plans to demerge its technology platform and switch the listing of its core beauty and nutrition business in an attempt to boost the e-commerce company’s flagging share price.】

item.title: 印度最有价值的抵押贷款机构竞争日趋激烈
item.description: Bajaj Housing Finance Ltd.是美国最有价值的按揭贷款公司，该公司在周一的首笔交易中表现抢眼，它认为随着大型银行从零售领域撤退，转而关注需求正在回升的企业信贷，住房市场的竞争将有所缓解。【原文：Bajaj Housing Finance Ltd., the country’s most valuable mortgage lender following its blockbuster trading debut Monday, sees competition in the housing market easing as larger banks retreat from retail segments and switch focus to corporate credit, where demand is picking up.】

item.title: 泰国政府提名央行批评人士担任 BOT 主席
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，泰国政府支持批评央行鹰派货币政策、忠于执政党的吉滴拉-纳-拉农（Kittiratt Na-Ranong）出任泰国央行新主席。【原文：Thailand’s government is backing Kittiratt Na-Ranong, a critic of the central bank’s hawkish monetary policy and a loyalist of the ruling party, to become the new chairman of the Bank of Thailand, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 波兰将宣布洪灾后重建计划
item.description: 波兰总理唐纳德-图斯克（Donald Tusk）周二表示，在洪水消退后，波兰将为受洪灾影响的地区制定一项复杂的重建计划。【原文：Poland will outline a complex reconstruction plan for the regions affected by the flood after the water subsides, Prime Minister Donald Tusk said on Tuesday.】

item.title: Flutter 同意以 23 亿欧元收购 Playtech 意大利分公司
item.description: Flutter Entertainment Plc 同意以 23 亿欧元（26 亿美元）的企业价值收购 Playtech Plc 旗下的意大利博彩业务，这是该公司最新的一次国际收购，Fanduel 的所有者利用美国的增长势头进行扩张。【原文：Flutter Entertainment Plc agreed to buy Playtech Plc’s Italian gambling business for an enterprise value of €2.3 billion ($2.6 billion) in its latest international acquisition as the Fanduel owner takes advantage of a growth surge in the US to expand.】

item.title: 利润率骤降，两家中化炼油厂宣布破产
item.description: 化工集团中化集团有限公司在中国经营的两家炼油厂宣布破产，凸显了老炼油厂在利润率急剧下降时面临的困境。【原文：Two oil refiners in China run by chemical conglomerate Sinochem Group Co. were declared bankrupt, highlighting the headwinds older units face as margins plummet.】

item.title: 新加坡房屋销售将迎来金融危机以来最差的一年
item.description: 据房地产咨询公司称，在又一个交易疲软的月份之后，他们下调了预测，新加坡今年的新房销售量很可能跌至全球金融危机以来的最低点。【原文：Singapore new-home sales are likely to fall this year to the lowest since the global financial crisis, according to property consultancies that cut their forecasts after yet another month of weak transactions.】

item.title: 日元突破 140 点，货币反向交易者削减日元买入头寸
item.description: 日本外汇保证金交易商平仓了日元多头头寸，因为日元周一走强，一年来首次突破了1美元兑140日元的关键心理价位。【原文：Foreign-exchange margin traders in Japan unwound long yen positions as the currency strengthened past the key psychological level of 140 yen per dollar on Monday for the first time in a year.】

item.title: 对冲基金 Brevan Howard 和千禧年提升日本交易排名
item.description: 在经济和货币政策波动扰乱市场之后，包括 Brevan Howard Asset Management LLP 和 Millennium Management LLC 在内的对冲基金公司继续加强其日本交易员队伍。【原文：Hedge fund firms including Brevan Howard Asset Management LLP and Millennium Management LLC continue to boost their ranks of Japan-focused traders after economic and monetary policy swings roiled markets.】

item.description:
如果 50 个基点的预期得到满足，那么要求更大幅度削减的压力就会增加。鲍威尔有理由向市场发出警告

。【原文：

If expectations are met at 50 basis points, the pressure will pile on for even bigger cuts. Powell has reason to call the market’s bluff

item.title: 欧盟被敦促通过发行联合债券弥补防空缺口
item.description: 布鲁塞尔智库布鲁盖尔（Bruegel）的一份新报告称，欧盟应考虑发行联合债务，为大量防空投资提供资金，以更好地保护其领空免遭俄罗斯可能的打击。【原文：The European Union should consider issuing joint debt to fund significant air-defense investments to better protect its airspace from possible Russian strikes, according to a new report from the Brussels-based think tank Bruegel.】

item.title: 斯塔默吸引投资者的计划取决于解决泰晤士河水务公司的问题
item.description:
政府将经济增长的希望寄托在从绿色能源到住房等各个方面的私人投资上。但是，投资者已经被泰晤士河的灾难所灼伤。【原文：

The government is pinning its hopes for growth on private investment in everything from green energy to housing. But investors have been burned by the Thames debacle.

】
